headline: Ask HN: FOIA'd US Social Security about ID.me use, got pushback. Worth pursuing?
description:
Hello HN,

Around the time of the investigative reporting that occurred regarding the IRS using ID.me as their identity proofing provider [0], I filed a Freedom of Information Act request [1] (or FOIA) with the Social Security Administration for documents and artifacts associated with their relationship with ID.me. I had requested they waive their fees, as I believed the information requested was in the public interest ("When Login.gov existed, why is the Social Security Administration not using Login.gov versus having a private contract with ID.me?") I was told they would not waive their fees, as I had not demonstrated releasing this information was in the public interest. I appealed, and recently received a response [2] that they were invoking 42 USC §1106(c) of the Social Security Act [3]:

"(c) Notwithstanding sections 552 and 552a of title 5, United States Code[11], or any other provision of law, whenever the Commissioner of Social Security or the Secretary determines that a request for information is made in order to assist a party in interest (as defined in section 3 of the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974[12] (29 U.S.C. 1002)) with respect to the administration of an employee benefit plan (as so defined), *or is made for any other purpose not directly related to the administration of the program or programs under this Act to which such information relates*, such Commissioner or Secretary may require the requester to pay the full cost, as determined by the such Commissioner or Secretary, of providing such information."

(emphasis mine)

I'm unsure if the above section was invoked due to the House Committee on Oversight and Reform currently investigating ID.me [4] [5], or if invoking this clause is legitimate for such a request. I believed when making the request that this was very much in the public interest.

If I want to continue with this information request, it will cost me about $3,000 in FOIA search fees [6]. I'm not asking for funds, but rather to seek feedback if continuing on this endeavor might surface material information on the topic that is in the public interest.

Thank you for your time.

[0] https://www.vice.com/en/article/z3nqy9/irs-stop-id-me-facial-recognition

[1] https://www.muckrock.com/foi/united-states-of-america-10/idme-documents-and-data-social-security-administration-122226/

[2] https://s3.documentcloud.org/documents/22077251/ssa-2022-004211-final-fee-waiver-appeal-response-letter-7-1-22.pdf

[3] https://www.ssa.gov/OP_Home/ssact/title11/1106.htm

[4] https://epic.org/congress-begins-investigation-into-face-verification-vendor-id-me/

[5] https://oversight.house.gov/sites/democrats.oversight.house.gov/files/2022-04-14.CBM%20JEC%20to%20Hall-ID.me%20re%20Use%20of%20FRT.pdf

[6] https://s3.documentcloud.org/documents/22120983/ssa-2022-003354-gallbraith-fee-notice.pdf
headline_zh-Hans: Ask HN: 我向美国社会安全局提出了关于ID.me使用的信息披露，得到了回绝。值得继续追查吗？
headline_zh-Hant: Ask HN: 我向美國社會安全局提出了關於ID.me使用的信息披露，得到了回絕。值得繼續追查嗎？
description_zh-Hans:
你好，

在关于国税局使用ID.me作为他们的身份证明供应商的调查报告[0]的前后，我向社会安全局提交了一份信息自由法案申请[1]（或FOIA），要求提供与他们与ID.me关系有关的文件和文物。我曾要求他们免除费用，因为我相信所要求的信息符合公共利益（"当Login.gov存在时，为什么社会安全局不使用Login.gov而要与ID.me签订私人合同？） 我被告知他们不会免除他们的费用，因为我没有证明发布这些信息是符合公共利益的。我提出上诉，最近收到答复[2]，他们援引《社会保障法》42 USC §1106(c)[3]：

"(c) 尽管有《美国法典》第5章第552和552a节[11]，或任何其他法律规定，只要社会保障专员或部长确定提出信息要求是为了协助利益方（如1974年《雇员退休收入保障法》第3节[12]（29 U.S.C. 1002）所定义的那样），就 1002），*或出于任何其他与该信息相关的本法规定的计划管理无直接关系的目的*，该专员或秘书可以要求请求者支付该专员或秘书确定的提供该信息的全部费用。 "

(emphasis mine)

我不确定上述条款的援引是否由于众议院监督和改革委员会目前正在调查ID.me [4] [5]，或者援引这一条款对于这样的请求是否合法。我在提出申请时认为，这非常符合公共利益。

如果我想继续申请这个信息，将花费我大约3000美元的FOIA搜索费[6]。我不是在要求资金，而是寻求反馈，如果继续这项工作可能会浮现出符合公共利益的主题的实质性信息。

感谢您的时间。

[0] https://www.vice.com/en/article/z3nqy9/irs-stop-id-me-facial-recognition

[1] https://www.muckrock.com/foi/united-states-of-america-10/idme-documents-and-data-social-security-administration-122226/

[2] https://s3.documentcloud.org/documents/22077251/ssa-2022-004211-final-fee-waiver-appeal-response-letter-7-1-22.pdf

[3] https://www.ssa.gov/OP_Home/ssact/title11/1106.htm

[4] https://epic.org/congress-begins-investigation-into-face-verification-vendor-id-me/

<5] https://oversight.house.gov/sites/democrats.oversight.house.gov/files/2022-04-14.CBM%20JEC%20to%20Hall-ID.me%20re%20Use%20of%20FRT.pdf

[6] https://s3.documentcloud.org/documents/22120983/ssa-2022-003354-gallbraith-fee-notice.pdf
description_zh-Hant:
你好，

在關於國稅局使用ID.me作為他們的身份證明供應商的調查報告[0]的前後，我向社會安全局提交了一份信息自由法案申請[1]（或FOIA），要求提供與他們與ID.me關係有關的文件和文物。我曾要求他們免除費用，因為我相信所要求的信息符合公共利益（"當Login.gov存在時，為什麼社會安全局不使用Login.gov而要與ID.me簽訂私人合同？） 我被告知他們不會免除他們的費用，因為我沒有證明發布這些信息是符合公共利益的。我提出上訴，最近收到答覆[2]，他們援引《社會保障法》42 USC §1106(c)[3]：

"(c) 儘管有《美國法典》第5章第552和552a節[11]，或任何其他法律規定，只要社會保障專員或部長確定提出信息要求是為了協助利益方（如1974年《僱員退休收入保障法》第3節[12]（29 U.S.C. 1002）所定義的那樣），就 1002），*或出於任何其他與該信息相關的本法規定的計劃管理無直接關係的目的*，該專員或秘書可以要求請求者支付該專員或秘書確定的提供該信息的全部費用。 "

(emphasis mine)

我不確定上述條款的援引是否由於眾議院監督和改革委員會目前正在調查ID.me [4] [5]，或者援引這一條款對於這樣的請求是否合法。我在提出申請時認為，這非常符合公共利益。

如果我想繼續申請這個信息，將花費我大約3000美元的FOIA搜索費[6]。我不是在要求資金，而是尋求反饋，如果繼續這項工作可能會浮現出符合公共利益的主題的實質性信息。

感謝您的時間。

[0] https://www.vice.com/en/article/z3nqy9/irs-stop-id-me-facial-recognition

[1] https://www.muckrock.com/foi/united-states-of-america-10/idme-documents-and-data-social-security-administration-122226/

[2] https://s3.documentcloud.org/documents/22077251/ssa-2022-004211-final-fee-waiver-appeal-response-letter-7-1-22.pdf

[3] https://www.ssa.gov/OP_Home/ssact/title11/1106.htm

[4] https://epic.org/congress-begins-investigation-into-face-verification-vendor-id-me/

<5] https://oversight.house.gov/sites/democrats.oversight.house.gov/files/2022-04-14.CBM%20JEC%20to%20Hall-ID.me%20re%20Use%20of%20FRT.pdf

[6] https://s3.documentcloud.org/documents/22120983/ssa-2022-003354-gallbraith-fee-notice.pdf
